islam.title: What is Islam?
islam.description: Islam is a monotheistic religion founded on the teachings of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It emphasizes peace, submission to God (Allah), and living a righteous life. Muslims follow the Five Pillars of Islam as the foundation of their faith.

ramadan.title: The Month of Ramadan
ramadan.description: Ramadan is the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar, observed by Muslims worldwide as a month of fasting, prayer, reflection, and community. It commemorates the first revelation of the Quran to Prophet Muhammad.

fasting.title: Fasting (Sawm)
fasting.description: During Ramadan, Muslims fast from dawn until sunset, abstaining from food, drink, and other physical needs. Fasting teaches self-discipline, empathy, and gratitude, while purifying the soul and strengthening faith.

eid.title: Eid al-Fitr
eid.description: Eid al-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan, celebrated with prayers, feasting, and giving gifts. It's a time of joy, gratitude, and community, where Muslims gather to share meals and exchange greetings with family and friends.

prayer.title: Prayer & Reflection
prayer.description: Ramadan is a time for increased prayer, reading the Quran, and spiritual reflection. Muslims engage in Taraweeh prayers at night and seek forgiveness, guidance, and blessings during this holy month.

charity.title: Charity (Zakat)
charity.description: Charity is highly emphasized during Ramadan. Muslims give Zakat (obligatory charity) and Sadaqah (voluntary charity) to help those in need, fostering compassion, generosity, and social responsibility.
